title: üêü How to Block in the new client without first adding them as a "friend"
body:
**Edit: With patch 7.10 they've added blocking from the Block List (in your Settings) and your Recently Played list (in the Add a Friend window).**

I've just been educated by our resident Riot tech support, Prynce, on a workaround for blocking players in the new client without needing them on your friends list (until they update it at least). It's quite simple, and he's created an infograph with directions;

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/267154390849290244/307295060100382720/BETA_Client_-_How_To_Block_Players.png

For text instructions I'll just repeat it here;

> 1. Go into your Profile page from the tabs on the top left of the client
2. On the top right side of your profile, enter the Summoner name
 * You can go to your own if they were in your recent matches
3. Go into their Match History tab and select any match
4. Find the player you wish to block, right click, select **Block**

There you go, the player is blocked! To view your Block list, just hit the **Settings** button on the top right of your client, the list is under the **Client** section.

Keep in mind that Blocking does not prevent a player from being matched with you. It only prevents them from sending you messages or requests, and automatically mutes them in lobby and in-game chat.

This was the goal of the new client; to permanently replace the old one. They reached the point where the new client was fully operational and the legacy client was no longer needed as a backup, so they've moved to Phase 2 (at least in NA) and removed the ability to use it. If this phase goes smoothly, the next is to remove the legacy client files from the League folder entirely in all regions.

If you have any issues with the new client, please make bug reports with the button on the bottom right of the client, and post on the [**Help & Support**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/osqw6G4M) board for troubleshooting assistance.
